cnbc.title: Alex Pretti killing: Minnesota CEOs, including UnitedHealth, Target, call for 'immediate deescalation'
cnbc.summary: The Trump administration has surged federal law enforcement to the city to enforce its immigration crackdown and pursue allegations of widespread welfare fraud.

cnbc.title: Videos of Alex Pretti shooting by federal agents in Minneapolis contradict Trump official claims
cnbc.summary: Footage from at least one of the videos appears to show a federal officer disarming the victim before shots are fired.

cnbc.title: Partial government shutdown more likely over DHS funding fight after Alex Pretti killing
cnbc.summary: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer of New York says he'll vote against DHS  funding after federal agents fatally shot Alex Pretti in Minneapolis.

cnbc.title: Flight disruptions from massive winter storm will linger Monday
cnbc.summary: U.S. airlines canceled tens of thousands of flights and waived change fees for travelers as a massive winter storm swept across the country.

cnbc.title: Auto executives are hoping for the best and planning for the worst in 2026
cnbc.summary: Automakers are entering a new phase of uncertainty as they deal with affordability issues and slowing consumer demand.

cnbc.title: The U.S. states where you can retire at 65 with less than $1 million in savings
cnbc.summary: In many states in the South and Midwest, lower housing costs make it possible to retire with $1 million or less.

cnbc.title: Trump accounts get supercharged by employer matches — some companies offer up to $1,000
cnbc.summary: A growing number of large employers have announced that they will match contributions to Trump accounts for their employees.

cnbc.title: Musk’s $1 trillion pay package renews focus on soaring CEO compensation
cnbc.summary: Elon Musk's stock-fueled gains highlight the booming compensation and wealth gains of CEOs in recent decades.

cnbc.title: Trump threatens to impose 100% tariff if Canada makes deal with China
cnbc.summary: In his Truth Social post, Trump suggested that China would try to use Canada to try to avoid paying U.S. tariffs.

cnbc.title: Major winter storm may affect over 170 million Americans — how much it could cost you
cnbc.summary: Many households can expect to pay more to cover groceries, heating, disrupted travel plans and insured losses due to the winter storm expected to hit the U.S.
